A spectacular mountain landscape. Waterfalls drop down massive rock faces to inland lakes. Rivers push through forest. Forest spreads across valley floors, which rise t snow peaks. 3
CALEB wakes abruptly - - to find himself in the front seat of a helicopter. The pilot, JAY, is a man in his forties. Outside the window is the mountain landscape.
How long was I out?
You fell asleep almost as soon as we left the airport. CALEB looks around.   Wipes sleep out of his eyes.   Gets bearings.
Damn. Can't believe I've been missing this. I was so psyched to be coming here, I was awake all night. JAY smiles.
You're a programmer, right?
Yeah.
Bay facility?
Long Island. I work on algorithms for the search engine.
Algorithms. Nice.
You know what they are?
Nope. But I knew you were a programmer. Soon as I set eyes on you.
Is that a good thing?
Means you and Mr Bateman speak the same language. I'd say that's a good thing. Beat.
I guess you know him pretty well. The pilot laughs.
I've never even met him. I only fly this shuttle between the airport and his residence.
I did see him one time. Stood on one of these mountain ridges. JAY shrugs.
Assume it was him, anyway. No one else around for a hundred miles. JAY glances over at CALEB.
So how does a programmer from Long Island get to be meeting the CEO?
I won a competition. It was kind of like a lottery, for employees. The winner got to spend a week with him.
The president can't get Mr Bateman on the phone, but you got the golden ticket.
Yep.
Hell of an opportunity.
Believe me. I know it. CALEB looks out of the window.
Incredible here.
Alaska.   Most beautiful place on Earth. Beat.
How long until we get to his estate? JAY chuckles.

CALEB looks down at the breathtaking view as the helicopt banks, turns, and descends. 8

Meadow flowers whip in the rotor wash as the helicopter touches down in the vast meadow. By the landing site is a collection of huge metal crates. All have Chinese characters on the side. The rotor blades slow, but don't stop. JAY exits. 9

JAY holds open the door as CALEB exits the helicopter cab CALEB looks around, his eyes adjusting to the bright suns outside. JAY goes to the side of the helicopter, pops open a hatch and removes CALEB'S luggage. A large suitcase with wheels CALEB looks around. Apart from the packing crates, there no man-made structures to be seen. CALEB shouts over the engine noise.
You're leaving me here?
This is as close as I'm allowed to the building.
... What building? The pilot gestures vaguely towards the white water.
Follow the river. JAY hands CALEB his bag.

Please get a safe distance from the blades. The pilot gets back inside the helicopter, and closes the door. CALEB hurriedly retreats with his bag. Moments later, in a roar of wind and noise, the helicopte lifting off. Equally suddenly, the noise is fading, and the helicopter soaring upwards, and banking back towards the glacier. Then it is gone.    Bird song and wind rush replace engin noise. CALEB suddenly looks very isolated. 10

CALEB walks along the banks of the fast-flowing river, awkwardly bumping his wheeled suitcase over the ground. The banks of the river start to climb, to an intimidating drop. It feels that this can't be the right way. CALEB reaches into his pocket and pulls out his mobile ph No signal at all. He puts his phone back in his pocket. 11
CALEB rounds a bend in the river. Ahead, almost hidden in trees, there is a steel and glass structure.

CALEB walks towards the house through the trees. In the ground, in a grassy clearing, he finds a circular window, reflecting the sky. He walks up to the window, and looks inside. It reveals what is effectively a glass-covered well - abo four metres deep, with smooth concrete sides. At the bottom of the well is a brightly-lit room, which appears to be an office of some sort. There is a desk, wi monitors, and a chair. But apparently no one inside. Beyond the clearing, in the tree-line, CALEB sees - almos camouflaged by forest - the dark shapes and straight line a low, one storey building complex.
CALEB approaches the building. As he nears the entrance - - CALEB startles, as an AUTOMATED VOICE speaks to him, fr an unknown source.
Caleb Smith. CALEB tracks the source of the voice. Near what seems to be the front door, a pillar protrudes the ground. Head-height. With a GLASS SCREEN on one side. Below the screen is a DISPENSER.
... Yes.

Please approach the console and face the screen. CALEB looks into the screen, and as soon as he has locked eyes with his own reflection, the screen FLASHES. A singl bright strobe. Almost immediately afterwards, something small clatters i the DISPENSER.
Take your keycard.
CALEB picks the object up.      It's a credit-card sized On it, there is an embedded chip, and a photograph of his face. He looks comically surprised.
... Can we do another?
Your keycard now may be used to enter the residence.

CALEB walks up to the front door. Beside the door, a KEYCARD PLATE is set into the wall, wi RED LED LIGHT. He holds his keycard ID. The RED LED light changes to BLUE. CALEB pushes the front door, and it swings open. 13
The front door opens to a glass-walled staircase, which l down to an open-plan room. At the bottom of the staircase, CALEB waits to see if he welcomed, or noticed. But he is not.
Hello?
Silence. Then he is startled a second time, by sudden commencement a THUMPING SOUND. Abrupt.    Rapid.    More or less rhythmic.   From somewh nearby. He exits in the direction of the noise.
CALEB enters a dining area. Which now reveals... ... a huge glass door. It presents an arresting view of a garden, river, and the mountains behind.
The door is open, and through it, we see the reason for t thumping sound. Just outside, on a patio, in the sunshine, a man is worki PUNCH BAG. 14

CALEB exits the dining area to an area of neat garden, looking over the river, and surrounded by the mountain ranges. The punch bag is suspended by a chain on an exterior flan wall of the house. The man working it is wearing shorts, and is shirtless. Bathed in sweat. His hands are not protected by gloves. Only wraps. Spots blood seep through the pale material around his knuckles. This is NATHAN BATEMAN.   He's thirty. After a flurry of punches, NATHAN breaks off. Breathing hard, he wipes at his eyebrows with the back of wrist. Sweat droplets cascade down his face. Then - - NATHAN senses the other presence. He turns to see CALEB.    Standing by the open glass wall
Caleb. NATHAN beams.
Caleb Smith.
... Hi. NATHAN starts unravelling his wraps.
Dude. I've been so looking forward to this. 15
NATHAN walks past CALEB, and goes to a bar area, where th is a jug of non-specific vegetable juice waiting, and a glass.
NATHAN
Come in, come in. CALEB puts his bag down. NATHAN (CONT'D)
You want something to eat or drink after your journey? CALEB
No.    Thank you. I'm fine.
You sure? NATHAN pours himself a glass of the vegetable juice. NATHAN (CONT'D)
I'd been thinking we'd have breakfast together, but to be honest, I can't eat anything right now. I gotta tell you - I woke up this morning with the mother of all fucking hangovers.
Yeah? NATHAN laughs. NATHAN
Like you wouldn't believe. And if I have a heavy night, I always try to compensate the next morning. Exercise. Juice. Anti-oxidants. You know?
Sure. Silence, as NATHAN drinks. CALEB feels he needs to say something. Looking around, he sees a collection of empty beer bottle the kitchen counter. CALEB (CONT'D)
... Was it a good party? NATHAN doesn't answer. He's still drinking. The silence extends a little.   Verges on odd. NATHAN puts his empty glass down.
NATHAN
Party? NATHAN looks at CALEB.   His expression is unreadable. NATHAN (CONT'D)
Caleb. I'm going to put this out there so it's said. CALEB waits. NATHAN (CONT'D)
You're freaked out. CALEB
... I am? NATHAN

Yeah. You're freaked out by the house, and the mountains, because it's all so super-cool. And you're freaked out by me. To be meeting me. In this room, having this conversation, at this moment. Right? CALEB doesn't have time to answer. NATHAN (CONT'D)
And I get that. The moment you're having. NATHAN smiles. NATHAN (CONT'D)
But dude, can we get it behind us? Can we just be two guys? Nathan and Caleb. Not the whole employer- employee thing. CALEB
Okay. Beat. CALEB (CONT'D)
It's good to meet you, Nathan. CALEB holds out his hand. NATHAN beams. NATHAN
It's good to meet you too, Caleb. They shake.
When CALEB takes his hand back, there is a little smear o blood on his fingers. He discretely wipes it on his trousers. 16
NATHAN and CALEB enter an elevator. It has no buttons.   Only a keycard plate. NATHAN swipes his card.
Down. The elevator starts to move.

CALEB and NATHAN exit the elevator, into a glass corridor The floor is polished concrete. The walls and ceiling are glass, behind which diffused light glows. At regular intervals, glass doors are set, glowing with t same light, flush with the walls. Beside the closed doors are keycard plates and soft red L CALEB carries his bag, looking slightly encumbered next t NATHAN.
So I guess the first thing I should do is explain your pass. It's simple enough. It opens some doors, but it doesn't open others. And that just makes everything easy for you, right?
... Uh, yes.
Because you're like: oh fuck, I'm in someone else's house, can I do this, can I do that? And this card takes all that worry away. If you try to open a door and it stays shut: okay, it's off limits.

Let's try this one. CALEB hunts around in his pockets for his keycard. Then swipes the card on the plate. The LED turns blue.

NATHAN follows CALEB into a bedroom.
You like? It has the vibe of a mid-level business hotel.      Bed, TV. Except it has no windows.

Caleb. There's a reason the room has no windows.

And I want to talk to you about what I'm researching. I want to share it with you. In fact, I want to share it with you so much, it's eating me up inside. Beat.

Dude.   Cheers. CALEB lifts his bottle too.

Sweet dreams. 29
